questions.question: We expect to get the ……………………………. news in a few hours.
questions.description: We use latest to refer to new or very recent things.

questions.question: The ……………………… news from the border is very disquieting.
questions.description: We use latest to refer to new or very recent things.

questions.question: The ………………………. time I saw him he was in high spirits.
Today is the ……………………………. day for receiving tenders.
His house is ………………………. to mine.
questions.description: Next can mean nearest in space in a few common expressions like next door and next to.

questions.question: We will get off at the ………………………… station.
questions.description: Next can mean after this / that one.

questions.question: As soon as she finished one project, she started working on …………………..
questions.description: Next is used to talk about time or series. It can mean the one after this one.

questions.question: Both the tiger and the leopard are cats but the former is much larger than the ………………………..
questions.description: Latter is the opposite of former.

questions.question: This is the …………………………. car I buy.
She is the ………………………. student in her year.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are only used to talk about the members of a family.

questions.question: He is five years …………………………… than me.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are only used attributively (before nouns)

questions.question: I must have a reply without any ………………………….. delay.
